reviewText:
Detective Classics, Volume 2, 6 DVD

This product has six mystery movies from the 1930s with these actors: Ralph Byrd, Peter Lorre, Boris Karloff, and Basil Rathbone. Each individual movie may be found in other collections, such as the Mystery Classics 50 Pack (which places four movies on a double sided DVD disk). You may refer to the individual reviews for more information.

Dick Tracys Dilemma [1947] begins with a robbery murder at a fur vault. They track the connection to The Claw. Dick Tracy pursues The Claw who meets his end while hiding by a high voltage transformer.

"Mr. Moto's Last Warning" [1939] tells about a plot to provoke conflict between French squadrons and the British fleet in Egypt. Can Mr. Moto prevent this action by foreign agents? Will a dummy reveal a secret?

"Mr. Wong  Doomed to Die" [1940] begins with a mystery blaze on a ship that killed 400 people. The Maritime Commission investigates. A man was shot, the police arrest the last person to visit him. Mr. Wong investigates, then it threatened. Was smuggling involved? Mr. Wong finds the guilty and frees the wrongfully accused. [Was this based on the Morro Castle disaster?]

Mr. Wong  Fatal Hour [1940] begins in San Francisco, it shows Coit Tower then the Golden Gate Bridge. A murdered reporter was in the water! Was it about emerald jade jewelry? A jewelry store owner is dead. Does a suspect have a good alibi? Could a mechanical device create an alibi? Wong solves this case.

Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon [1942] tells about a plot to steal a bombsight to aid a foreign power. Its four parts are produced in separate factories [as a security measure]. Will foreign agents be able to steal this secret weapon?

Sherlock Holmes - Terror By Night [1946] is about an expensive diamond which brings bad luck to its owner. Sherlock Holmes will guard it. There is a murder in a railway carriage, one of the passengers must be the murderer!

I GAVE THIS AS A BIRTHDAY GIFT TO  MY NEPHEW, UNFORTUNATELY 'MR MOTOS  LAST WARNING ' WAS ALL SCREWED UP AND HE SAID HE COULD NOT GET IT TO PLAY.  THE OTHER MOVIES WERE FINE.  I REALLY ENJOY THESE OLD MOVIES, I WOULD RECOMMEND THEM.
